name: Mount Afadjato
address: Near Liati Wote, Hohoe District, Volta Region, Ghana
description: The highest mountain in Ghana, offering breathtaking views, lush vegetation, and hiking trails. A paradise for adventurers and nature lovers.

name: Wli Waterfalls
description: Known as the tallest waterfall in West Africa, Wli Waterfalls is surrounded by tropical forests and is a haven for ecotourism and birdwatching.

name: Tafi Atome Monkey Sanctuary
address: Tafi Atome Village, Volta Region, Ghana
description: A community-based sanctuary protecting the Mona monkeys. Visitors can interact with the monkeys and learn about local conservation efforts.

name: Volta Lake
address: Spanning across the Volta Region, Ghana
description: The largest artificial lake in the world by surface area, offering opportunities for fishing, boating, and scenic views.

name: Kente Weaving Village (Kpetoe)
description: Known for its traditional kente weaving, this village offers visitors an authentic cultural experience and insight into the craftsmanship of Ghanaian textiles.

name: Gemi Mountain Cross
description: A historic cross located atop Gemi Mountain, providing panoramic views of the region and a serene atmosphere for reflection.

name: Tafi Abuife Traditional Smock Center
description: Renowned for its production of traditional smocks, this center highlights Ghanaian heritage and craftsmanship.

name: Adaklu Mountain
description: A towering mountain known for its cultural significance and climbing challenges, attracting both locals and tourists.
